alert.note: Alert for Allen; Evangeline; Rapides (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 10:14AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Rapides, Evangeline and Allen Parishes through 1045 AM CDT... At 1014 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Harmony, or near Mittie, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alexandria, Pineville, Oakdale, Ville Platte, Mamou, Kinder, Oberlin, Glenmora, Cheneyville, Elizabeth, Turkey Creek, Reeves, Alexandria International Airport, Hineston, Mittie, Ball, Pine Prairie, Lecompte, Bayou Chicot and Tioga. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 55 and 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for central, southwestern and west central Louisiana.
